instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165A: What is 820-00165A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: fan spin, No p1v05s0 and no cpuvr what should i check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> goes high?
Do you get voltage on the other big coils?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Thank you, it was <RESISTOR>R7612</RESISTOR> i replaced it getting all voltage but no back light 22.8v on <CAPACITOR>C7799</CAPACITOR> i test with working screen it's same and <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> 1.4v any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Try PRAM reset 2-3 times, then check pressing backlight up key.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: it was <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> replaced it working fine thank you
